text: Traditional Mexican tamales filled with Swiss chard, seasoned with local herbs and wrapped in corn husks. A classic dish enjoyed during festivals and family gatherings in Tepotzotlán.
A hearty mushroom soup made with fresh, locally harvested mushrooms, simmered with spices and herbs. A flavorful dish reflecting the region’s culinary traditions.
Tender meat marinated with chili, herbs, and spices, wrapped in maguey leaves, and slow-cooked to perfection. A staple of Tepotzotlán’s traditional cuisine.
